name: deceptively
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is deceptive (= making you believe something that is not true): The plan seemed deceptively simple (= it seemed simple but was not). The tool is noisy to use and deceptively dangerous (= it is more dangerous than it seems). See
deceptive
More examplesFewer examplesShe writes with extraordinary clarity and makes it look deceptively easy.His voice was deceptively innocent, and she was led right into the trap.Conditions ahead of the storm were deceptively calm.With a deceptively strong arm she shoved him aside.They alleged that he had acted deceptively.
